intro: Galium lucidum var. fruticescens, commonly known as shining bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of North America. It typically features slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
